title: These Are The Reasons That Games becomes Coinflips.
body:
**AutoFill**
if u have 3 autofilled teammate on ur team and enemy are all on their main role. u lost the coinflip.
---------------------------------------------------------------
**DUO Partners.**
if one team has duo and the other team doesnt have duo then that game is a coinflip. That Duo Decides the game for other 8 people in the game. if good duo they will 2v8 and if bad duo they will run it down as 2 doesnt matter what other 8 players does.
---------------------------------------------------------------
**Smurfs.**
if ur enemy has 2 smurfs and u have none. u lost the coinflip.
---------------------------------------------------------------
**Trolls.**
Since trolls dont get banned or anything.they are always there. if u have troll on ur team then u lost the coinflip. BUT u can use that Report button after the game i dont know what that button does but its better to use it anyway.
---------------------------------------------------------------
**MatchMaking.**
if Average MMR of ur team is silver 1 and average MMR of ur enemy team is gold 3 u lost the coinflip. BUT instead of 21LP u only lose 17LP. still u lost coinflip.
---------------------------------------------------------------
Edited : Of Course All of These Games Are Winnable. And u can 1v9. But that doesnt mean u won the coinflip. u just did the impossible.

the theory of big numbers means that those cancel each other out
with you being the only factor you can influence the most your win rate is decided only by your own performance

this means that you can't have an absurd high win rate unless you are miles ahead of everyone in the game in terms of knowledge and mechanics (this is why tf blade gets challenger accounts from unranked in a few weeks)
but even if you see his accounts by the time he reaches high challenger his win rate starts to even out towards 50%

his euw rank 1 climb was with 67% win rate
his na rank 1 account that kept for 2 years was with 55% win rate

if you notice that even an amazing soloq player can't have an absurd win rate around his skill level

in a balanced working elo system any player should have 50-55%win rate based only on their consistency in game if you are really consistent you can go above 55% barely
this is proven with every account in challenger that has 500+ games only very very few accounts with such amount of games have above 55% and even if they do they are 56 or 57%
This is only because your own performance is responsible for 20% of your games
if you are a 4fun player you will have 50% if you troll you will have less than 50% if you are consistently good you will have more

Nobody has ever argued that you can't climb over a large sample size of games.  People have argued that it is a grind because many individual games are completely out of your control.  

Many people are ranked incorrectly. Some are temporarily ranked too low and some are temporarily ranked too high.   

It is entirely possible to be a platinum player and be stuck in gold for a lot of games.  it is possible to be a gold player and stuck in silver for quite a few games.  It is possible to be a diamond player and be stuck in plat.  

Nobody is arguing that diamond players can't carry bronze games.  People are arguing that the climb takes longer than it should and that it's a grind.  People lose interest and give up because it isn't fun.

I've been to plat 2 promos like 7 times this season back to back.  I'd hard stomp games going like 14/0 and then I'd get to promos only to have some kid afk or rage.  It's insane.  If I kept grinding I'd get my plat 2.  Hell I'd probably get mid diamond or so.  But the entire fun has been sucked out of the game for me by these individuals. 

Can you imagine going into a plat 1/diamond 4 mmr game and having an adc on your team who goes 0/18?  Then he flames you . You look him up and you see he diamond 1 last season and is plat 2 currently.   Can you say bought account?  

I've had 0/14 adcs, jungles, and tops who were last season diamond.  I've had kids afk because they got ganked by jungles.  I've had people out damaged by soraka support.  It's stupid.  

Even queuing for ranked on my main makes me physically ill.  I feel my stomach churn at the thought of playing on it.  The games are fucking cancer.

One would need a very specific context for 1 + 1 to equal 2. Math might be efficient at dealing with the practical/pragmatic side of this world (mainly static objects or mechanical like robots) - but it's not that efficient when it comes to dynamic and organic elements - such as people.

Also, what works for one doesn't work for everyone. We may all be humans (so to speak) - but we're not all the same. As can be seen in school - some are great at math (without trying), others are prodigies when it comes to arts, sports, literature, music and so on (again, without trying). One game a gold player could play like a diamond, the next he'll look like he belongs in Iron. I know this, because I see it in every game I play. I played two back to back games with the same person - in one he was so bad he looked like he was trolling... in the next he went like 13/2... and I do the same thing too sometimes, I can go from 0/6 to 8/2 in back to back games with the same champ.

Coin flip means you have no influence on the game whatsoever, then how do people like me end up in GM? I was in Diamond less than 2 weeks ago, climbed pretty quickly once I got my main champion back to Viability, from the jungle mind you which everyone thinks is god awful and can't carry xD

It's all about skill differential.  It is entirely possible to be challenger/GM and carry through plat.  It is another thing entirely to be mid to low diamond in skill and carry in plat.  IT's going to require more games to climb because the skill differential is less.   

For example, on my one trick, in platinum, I average less than 3 deaths per game, a 5+kda, 7-8 cs a minute, and I out perform Morgana players in all elos in all metrics except for own deaths (I die less than half as much as the average Morgana).   Yet the games are coinflippy for me.  Can I climb to diamond?  Sure, but it's going to take me a long time to do it.  

You see this a lot in challenger smurfs.  They'll rocket through the ladder and then stall out in high diamond because the skill differential is less.  Tyler1 for example is a top 5 challenger player.  The guy is a beast.  He was hard stuck diamond earlier this season during his bet with Yassuo.  

People are complaining because if you're better than people in your elo you should climb faster.  It's frustrating for me, for example, to go 5/0 in lane every game, have good roams, and good macro level play, but lose because people who were last season diamond go 0/15 in my games.  But I'm not saying it's impossible to climb.  Just that it's a grind and it's incredibly unfun.
